root.pub-comments: Campbell cites Cerrón-Palomino 1987. "Kechua is a language complex like Romance, Misteko, or Sapoteko. There is a great deal of internal diversification." (Kaufman, 70)
root.publications: Campbell, Lyle. The classification of South American languages. In Lyle Campbell & Verónica Grondona (eds.), South America. Berlin: Mouton de Gruyter. , Kaufman, Terrence. 2007. Atlas of the World's Languages, 2 edn., 70. London, New York: Routledge.
